thread.section_title: TrekEarth - South America Travel Photo Gallery
thread.title: Greenhouse

title: Greenhouse
text:
Only registered TrekEarth members may write critiques. Photographer's Note 
Inaugurated in October 5 of 1991, the Greenhouse of Curitiba's Botanical Garden contains numerous plant specimens from Brazil and other countries. The structure is made of iron and glass with three vaults and have a Art Nouveau style inspired by the London Crystal Palace. The greenhouse is acclimatized and holds species of the Atlantic Forest as Caraguatá, Caeté and Palmetto. From the inside you have a privileged view of the French style garden. 
Nobody has marked this note useful
